definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: I didn’t recognize the heartburn for what it was because I had never experienced it before.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有識別出胃灼熱，因爲我以前從未經歷過。

sentences.english: Over the counter drugs and medications can also help in heartburn relief .
sentences.chinese: 在反毒品和藥物也可以幫助胃灼熱救濟。

sentences.english: Proton pump inhibitors can tackle really stubborn heartburn.
sentences.chinese: 質子泵抑制劑可以治療頑固性胃灼熱。

sentences.english: A short time after that, I stared having heartburn.
sentences.chinese: 一個短的時間之後，我看着有胃灼熱。

sentences.english: One of these is to take vinegar treatment for heartburn, especially apple cider vinegar .
sentences.chinese: 其中之一是採取食醋治療胃灼熱，特別是蘋果醋。

sentences.english: In the case of severe heartburn one may not be enough to bring relief.
sentences.chinese: 在案件嚴重胃灼熱的一個可能仍不足以紓緩。

definition: bacterial tracheitis (inflammation of the windpipe, often caused by Staphylococcus aureus)/henpecked (a pun on 妻子管得严 used in comic theater)
(of food) to retain in stomach due to indigestion (TCM)
an excess of heat caused by a deficiency in Yin energy (idiom)

pinyin: feng1 shi1 xing4 guan1 jie2 yan2
